/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/1/ii.content: if the application was made by an employer under section216DA—the variation has been genuinely agreed to by the affected employees in accordance with section216DD; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/1/iii.content: if the application was made by an employee organisation under section216DB—the requirements of subsection(1A) are met; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/1/iv.content: the requirements of either subsection(2) or (3) (which deal with franchisees and common interest employers) are met; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/1/v.content: if the requirements of subsection(3) are met—the operations and business activities of the employer are reasonably comparable with those of the other employers who are covered by the agreement. (1AA)If:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/1/c.content: subsection(1C) does not apply to the employer. (1B)For the purposes of paragraph(1A)(b), the FWC may work out whether a majority of the affected employees want to be covered by the agreement using any method the FWC considers appropriate. (1C)This subsection applies to an employer if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/2.content: The requirements of this subsection are met if the employers covered by the agreement and the employer that will be covered by the agreement carry on similar business activities under the same franchise and are:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/2/a.content: franchisees of the same franchisor; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/2/b.content: related bodies corporate of the same franchisor; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/2/c.content: any combination of the above. Common interest employers

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/3.content: The requirements of this subsection are met if it is appropriate to approve the variation, having regard to:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/3/a.content: the employer is bargaining in good faith for a proposed enterprise agreement that will cover the employer and the affected employees, or substantially the same group of the affected employees; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/3/b.content: the employer and the affected employees have a history of effectively bargaining in relation to one or more enterprise agreements that have covered the employer and the affected employees, or substantially the same group of the affected employees; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/3/c.content: on the day that the FWC will approve the variation, less than 9 months have passed since the most recent nominal expiry date of an agreement referred to in paragraph(b). General building and construction work

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/3/d.content: associated entities of the employer are taken to be one entity. Employers and employees that are already bargaining (3B)Despite subsection(1), the FWC may refuse to approve the variation if the FWC is satisfied that:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/4.content: Despite subsection(1), the FWC must not approve the variation if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/4/a.content: the agreement is a greenfields agreement that covers employees in relation to general building and construction work; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/4/b.content: as a result of the variation,the agreement would cover employees in relation to general building and construction work. Supported bargaining authorisation

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DC/5.content: Despite subsection(1), the FWC must not approve the variation if the employer that will be covered by the agreement is specified in a supported bargaining authorisation in relation to any of the affected employees.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD.title: Determining whether a variation of a single interest employer agreement to add employer and employees has been genuinely agreed to by affected employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1.content: For the purposes of subparagraph216DC(1)(b)(ii), the FWC is todetermine whether it is satisfied that the variation has been genuinely agreed to by the affected employees in accordance with section188, modified as follows:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/a.content: as if references (other than in a note) to an enterprise agreement being genuinely agreed to were references to the variation being genuinely agreed to;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/b.content: as if references to employees covered by or expressed to be covered by the agreement, employees requested to approve the agreement by voting for it, or employees, were references to the affected employees;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/c.content: as if, in paragraph188(2)(a), the reference to the agreement were a reference to the agreement as proposed to be varied;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/d.content: as if subsections188(2A), (3) and (4) were omitted;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/e.content: as if, in subsections188(4A) and (5), references to subsection180(5) were references to section216DAA;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/1/f.content: as if, in paragraph188(5)(c), the reference to subsection182(1) or (2) were a reference to subsection216D(5).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/2.content: In taking into account the statement of principles made under section188B:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/2/a.content: the FWC may disregard the matters mentioned in paragraphs 188B(3)(a) and (b); and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/2/b.content: the matters mentioned in paragraphs 188B(3)(c) and (d) are taken to be matters relating to the agreement as proposed to be varied; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/2/c.content: the matters mentioned in paragraphs 188B(3)(e) are taken to be matters relating to the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DD/3.content: The regulations may provide that, for the purposes of the FWC determining whether it is satisfied that the variation has been genuinely agreed to by the affected employees for the purposes of subparagraph216DC(1)(b)(ii), specified provisions of this Part, or regulations made for the purposes of this Part, have effect with such modifications as are prescribed by the regulations.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE.title: When the FWC may refuse to approve a variation of a single interest employer agreement
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE.content:
(1)If an application for the approval of a variation of a single interest employer agreement is made under section216DA or 216DB, the FWC may refuse to approve the variation if the FWC considers that compliance with the terms of the agreement as proposed to be varied may result in:
(a)a person committing an offence against a law of the Commonwealth; or
(b)a person being liable to pay a pecuniary penalty in relation to a contravention of a law of the Commonwealth.
(2)Subsection(1) has effect despite section216DC (which deals with the approval of variations of single interest employer agreements).
(3)If the FWC refuses to approve a variation of a single interest employer agreement under this section, the FWC may refer the agreement as proposed to be varied to any person or body the FWC considers appropriate.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE/1.content: If an application for the approval of a variation of a single interest employer agreement is made under section216DA or 216DB, the FWC may refuse to approve the variation if the FWC considers that compliance with the terms of the agreement as proposed to be varied may result in:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE/1/a.content: a person committing an offence against a law of the Commonwealth; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE/1/b.content: a person being liable to pay a pecuniary penalty in relation to a contravention of a law of the Commonwealth.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE/2.content: Subsection(1) has effect despite section216DC (which deals with the approval of variations of single interest employer agreements).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DE/3.content: If the FWC refuses to approve a variation of a single interest employer agreement under this section, the FWC may refer the agreement as proposed to be varied to any person or body the FWC considers appropriate.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DF.title: When variation comes into operation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216DF.content:
If a variation of a single interest employer agreement is approved under section216DC, the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to approve the variation.
Subdivision AE—Variation of multi‑enterprise agreement to remove employer and employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E.title: Variation of multi‑enterprise agreement to remove employer and employees with consent
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E.content:
Variation by employers and employees
(1)The following may jointly make a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement covered by subsection(2), that will have the effect that they will cease to be covered by the agreement:
(a)an employer that is covered by the agreement;
(b)the employees employed at the time who will cease to be covered by the agreement if the variation is approved by the FWC (theaffected employees).
(2)This subsection covers a multi‑enterprise agreement made after the commencement of this subsection if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement and there are 2 or more employers covered by the agreement.
Variation has no effect unless approved by the FWC
(3)The variation has no effect unless it is approved by the FWC under section216EB.
Approval by employee vote
(4)The employer may request the affected employees to approve the proposed variation by voting for it.
(5)Before making the request, the employer must:
(a)take all reasonable steps to notify the employees of the following:
(i)the time and place at which the vote will occur;
(ii)the voting method that will be used; and
(b)give the employees a reasonable opportunity to decide whether they want to approve the proposed variation.
(6)Without limiting subsection(4), the employer may request that the affected employees vote by ballot or by an electronic method.
When a variation is made
(7)The variation ismadewhen a majority of the affected employees who cast a valid vote approve the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/1.content: The following may jointly make a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement covered by subsection(2), that will have the effect that they will cease to be covered by the agreement: Variation by employers and employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/1/a.content: an employer that is covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/1/b.content: the employees employed at the time who will cease to be covered by the agreement if the variation is approved by the FWC (theaffected employees).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/2.content: This subsection covers a multi‑enterprise agreement made after the commencement of this subsection if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement and there are 2 or more employers covered by the agreement. Variation has no effect unless approved by the FWC

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/3.content: The variation has no effect unless it is approved by the FWC under section216EB. Approval by employee vote

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/4.content: The employer may request the affected employees to approve the proposed variation by voting for it.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/5.content: Before making the request, the employer must:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/5/a.content: take all reasonable steps to notify the employees of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/5/i.content: the time and place at which the vote will occur;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/5/ii.content: the voting method that will be used; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/5/b.content: give the employees a reasonable opportunity to decide whether they want to approve the proposed variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/6.content: Without limiting subsection(4), the employer may request that the affected employees vote by ballot or by an electronic method. When a variation is made

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216E/7.content: The variation ismadewhen a majority of the affected employees who cast a valid vote approve the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA.title: Application for the FWC’s approval of variation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA.content:
Application for approval
(1)If a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement is made as mentioned in section216E, one of the following must apply to the FWC for approval of the variation:
(a)the employer mentioned in paragraph216E(1)(a);
(b)an affected employee;
(c)an employee organisation covered by the agreement that is entitled to represent the industrial interests of an affected employee.
Material to accompany the application
(2)The application must be accompanied by any declarations that are required by the procedural rules to accompany the application.
When the application must be made
(3)The application must be made:
(a)within 14 days after the variation is made; or
(b)if in all the circumstances the FWC considers it fair to extend that period—within such further period as the FWC allows.
Signature requirements
(4)The regulations may prescribe requirements relating to the signing of variations of enterprise agreements.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/1.content: If a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement is made as mentioned in section216E, one of the following must apply to the FWC for approval of the variation: Application for approval

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/1/c.content: an employee organisation covered by the agreement that is entitled to represent the industrial interests of an affected employee. Material to accompany the application

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/2.content: The application must be accompanied by any declarations that are required by the procedural rules to accompany the application. When the application must be made

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/3/a.content: within 14 days after the variation is made; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/3/b.content: if in all the circumstances the FWC considers it fair to extend that period—within such further period as the FWC allows. Signature requirements

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EA/4.content: The regulations may prescribe requirements relating to the signing of variations of enterprise agreements.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB.title: When the FWC must approve variation of multi‑enterprise agreement to remove employer and employees
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB.content:
If an application for the approval of a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement is made under section216EA, the FWC must approve the variation if the FWC is satisfied that:
(a)the employer mentioned in paragraph216E(1)(a) complied with subsection216E(5) (which deals with giving employees a reasonable opportunity to decide etc.) in relation to the variation; and
(b)the affected employees have voted, by ballot or by an electronic method, on whether to approve the variation and, of those who cast a valid vote, a majority approved the variation; and
(c)there are no other reasonable grounds for believing that a majority of the affected employees who cast a valid vote did not approve the variation; and
(d)each employee organisation covered by the agreement, that is entitled to represent the industrial interests of one or more affected employees, agrees to the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB/a.content: the employer mentioned in paragraph216E(1)(a) complied with subsection216E(5) (which deals with giving employees a reasonable opportunity to decide etc.) in relation to the variation; and If an application for the approval of a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement is made under section216EA, the FWC must approve the variation if the FWC is satisfied that:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB/b.content: the affected employees have voted, by ballot or by an electronic method, on whether to approve the variation and, of those who cast a valid vote, a majority approved the variation; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB/c.content: there are no other reasonable grounds for believing that a majority of the affected employees who cast a valid vote did not approve the variation; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EB/d.content: each employee organisation covered by the agreement, that is entitled to represent the industrial interests of one or more affected employees, agrees to the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EC.title: When variation comes into operation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216EC.content: If a variation of a multi‑enterprise agreement is approved under section216EB, the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to approve the variation.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216ED.title: Effect of variation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s216ED.content:
A multi‑enterprise agreement that is varied under this Subdivision remains a multi‑enterprise agreement, despite the variation.
Subdivision B—Variations of enterprise agreements where there is ambiguity, uncertainty or discrimination

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217.title: Variation of an enterprise agreement to remove an ambiguity or uncertainty

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217/1.content: The FWC may vary an enterprise agreement to remove an ambiguity or uncertainty on application by any of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217/1/a.content: one or more of the employers covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217/1/b.content: an employee covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217/1/c.content: an employee organisation covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217/2.content: If the FWC varies the enterprise agreement, the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to vary the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217A.title: FWC may deal with certain disputes about variations
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217A.content:
(1)This section applies if a variation of an enterprise agreement is proposed.
(2)An employer or employee organisation covered by the enterprise agreement or an affected employee for the variation may apply to the FWC for the FWC to deal with a dispute about the proposed variation if the employer and the affected employees are unable to resolve the dispute.
(3)The FWC must not arbitrate (however described) the dispute.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217A/1.content: This section applies if a variation of an enterprise agreement is proposed.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217A/2.content: An employer or employee organisation covered by the enterprise agreement or an affected employee for the variation may apply to the FWC for the FWC to deal with a dispute about the proposed variation if the employer and the affected employees are unable to resolve the dispute.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s217A/3.content: The FWC must not arbitrate (however described) the dispute.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218.title: Variation of an enterprise agreement on referral by Australian Human Rights Commission
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218.content:
Review of an enterprise agreement
(1)The FWC must review an enterprise agreement if the agreement is referred to it under section46PW of theAustralian Human Rights Commission Act 1986(which deals with discriminatory industrial instruments).
(2)The following are entitled to make submissions to the FWC for consideration in the review:
(a)if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under Part4 of theAge Discrimination Act 2004—the Age Discrimination Commissioner;
(b)if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under Part2 of theDisability Discrimination Act 1992—the Disability Discrimination Commissioner;
(c)if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under PartII of theSex Discrimination Act 1984—the Sex Discrimination Commissioner.
Variation of an enterprise agreement
(3)If the FWC considers that the agreement reviewed requires a person to do an act that would be unlawful under any of the Acts referred to in subsection(2) (but for the fact that the act would be done in direct compliance with the agreement), the FWC must vary the agreement so that it no longer requires the person to do an act that would be so unlawful.
(4)If the agreement is varied under subsection(3), the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to vary the agreement.
Subdivision BA—Variation of enterprise agreements to correct or amend errors, defects or irregularities

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/1.content: The FWC must review an enterprise agreement if the agreement is referred to it under section46PW of theAustralian Human Rights Commission Act 1986(which deals with discriminatory industrial instruments). Review of an enterprise agreement

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/2.content: The following are entitled to make submissions to the FWC for consideration in the review:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/2/a.content: if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under Part4 of theAge Discrimination Act 2004—the Age Discrimination Commissioner;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/2/b.content: if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under Part2 of theDisability Discrimination Act 1992—the Disability Discrimination Commissioner;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/2/c.content: if the referral relates to action that would be unlawful under PartII of theSex Discrimination Act 1984—the Sex Discrimination Commissioner. Variation of an enterprise agreement

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/3.content: If the FWC considers that the agreement reviewed requires a person to do an act that would be unlawful under any of the Acts referred to in subsection(2) (but for the fact that the act would be done in direct compliance with the agreement), the FWC must vary the agreement so that it no longer requires the person to do an act that would be so unlawful.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218/4.content: If the agreement is varied under subsection(3), the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to vary the agreement. Subdivision BA—Variation of enterprise agreements to correct or amend errors, defects or irregularities

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A.title: Variation of enterprise agreements to correct or amend errors, defects or irregularities
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A.content:
(1)The FWC may vary an enterprise agreement to correct or amend an obvious error, defect or irregularity (whether in substance or form).
(2)The FWC may vary an enterprise agreement under subsection(1):
(a)on its own initiative; or
(b)on application by any of the following:
(i)one or more of the employers covered by the agreement;
(ii)an employee covered by the agreement;
(iii)an employee organisation covered by the agreement.
(3)If the FWC varies an enterprise agreement under subsection(1), the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to vary the agreement.
Subdivision C—Termination of enterprise agreements by employers and employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/1.content: The FWC may vary an enterprise agreement to correct or amend an obvious error, defect or irregularity (whether in substance or form).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/2.content: The FWC may vary an enterprise agreement under subsection(1):

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/2/b.content: on application by any of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/2/i.content: one or more of the employers covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/2/ii.content: an employee covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/2/iii.content: an employee organisation covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s218A/3.content: If the FWC varies an enterprise agreement under subsection(1), the variation operates from the day specified in the decision to vary the agreement. Subdivision C—Termination of enterprise agreements by employers and employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219.title: Employers and employees may agree to terminate an enterprise agreement
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219.content:
Termination by employers and employees
(1)The following may jointly agree to terminate an enterprise agreement:
(a)if the agreement covers a single employer—the employer and the employees covered by the agreement; or
(b)if the agreement covers 2 or more employers—all of the employers and the employees covered by the agreement.
Termination has no effect unless approved by the FWC
(2)A termination of an enterprise agreement has no effect unless it is approved by the FWC under section223.
Limitation—greenfields agreement
(3)Subsection(1) applies to a greenfields agreement only if one or more of the persons who will be necessary for the normal conduct of the enterprise concerned and are covered by the agreement have been employed.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219/1.content: The following may jointly agree to terminate an enterprise agreement: Termination by employers and employees

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219/1/a.content: if the agreement covers a single employer—the employer and the employees covered by the agreement; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219/1/b.content: if the agreement covers 2 or more employers—all of the employers and the employees covered by the agreement. Termination has no effect unless approved by the FWC

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219/2.content: A termination of an enterprise agreement has no effect unless it is approved by the FWC under section223. Limitation—greenfields agreement

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s219/3.content: Subsection(1) applies to a greenfields agreement only if one or more of the persons who will be necessary for the normal conduct of the enterprise concerned and are covered by the agreement have been employed.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220.title: Employers may request employees to approve a proposed termination of an enterprise agreement
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220.content:
(1)An employer covered by an enterprise agreement may request the employees covered by the agreement to approve a proposed termination of the agreement by voting for it.
(2)Before making the request, the employer must:
(a)take all reasonable steps to notify the employees of the following:
(i)the time and place at which the vote will occur;
(ii)the voting method that will be used; and
(b)give the employees a reasonable opportunity to decide whether they want to approve the proposed termination.
(3)Without limiting subsection(1), the employer may request that the employees vote by ballot or by an electronic method.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/1.content: An employer covered by an enterprise agreement may request the employees covered by the agreement to approve a proposed termination of the agreement by voting for it.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/2.content: Before making the request, the employer must:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/2/a.content: take all reasonable steps to notify the employees of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/2/i.content: the time and place at which the vote will occur;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/2/ii.content: the voting method that will be used; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/2/b.content: give the employees a reasonable opportunity to decide whether they want to approve the proposed termination.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s220/3.content: Without limiting subsection(1), the employer may request that the employees vote by ballot or by an electronic method.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s221.title: When termination of an enterprise agreement is agreed to
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s221.content:
Single‑enterprise agreement
(1)If the employees of an employer, or each employer, covered by a single‑enterprise agreement have been asked to approve a proposed termination of the agreement under subsection220(1), the termination isagreed towhen a majority of the employees who cast a valid vote approve the termination.
Multi‑enterprise agreement
(2)If the employees of each employer covered by a multi‑enterprise agreement have been asked to approve a proposed termination of the agreement under subsection220(1), the termination isagreed towhen a majority of the employees of each individual employer who cast a valid vote have approved the termination.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s221/1.content: If the employees of an employer, or each employer, covered by a single‑enterprise agreement have been asked to approve a proposed termination of the agreement under subsection220(1), the termination isagreed towhen a majority of the employees who cast a valid vote approve the termination. Single‑enterprise agreement Multi‑enterprise agreement

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s221/2.content: If the employees of each employer covered by a multi‑enterprise agreement have been asked to approve a proposed termination of the agreement under subsection220(1), the termination isagreed towhen a majority of the employees of each individual employer who cast a valid vote have approved the termination.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222.title: Application for the FWC’s approval of a termination of an enterprise agreement
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222.content:
Application for approval
(1)If a termination of an enterprise agreement has been agreed to, a person covered by the agreement must apply to the FWC for approval of the termination.
Material to accompany the application
(2)The application must be accompanied by any declarations that are required by the procedural rules to accompany the application.
When the application must be made
(3)The application must be made:
(a)within 14 days after the termination is agreed to; or
(b)if in all the circumstances the FWC considers it fair to extend that period—within such further period as the FWC allows.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222/1.content: If a termination of an enterprise agreement has been agreed to, a person covered by the agreement must apply to the FWC for approval of the termination. Application for approval Material to accompany the application

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222/2.content: The application must be accompanied by any declarations that are required by the procedural rules to accompany the application. When the application must be made

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222/3/a.content: within 14 days after the termination is agreed to; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s222/3/b.content: if in all the circumstances the FWC considers it fair to extend that period—within such further period as the FWC allows.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223.title: When the FWC must approve a termination of an enterprise agreement
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223.content:
If an application for the approval of a termination of an enterprise agreement is made under section222, the FWC must approve the termination if:
(a)the FWC is satisfied that each employer covered by the agreement complied with subsection220(2) (which deals with giving employees a reasonable opportunity to decide etc.) in relation to the agreement; and
(b)the FWC is satisfied that the termination was agreed to in accordance with whichever of subsection221(1) or (2) applies (those subsections deal with agreement to the termination of different kinds of enterprise agreements by employee vote); and
(c)the FWC is satisfied that there are no other reasonable grounds for believing that the employees have not agreed to the termination; and
(d)the FWC considers that it is appropriate to approve the termination taking into account the views of the employee organisation or employee organisations (if any) covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223/a.content: the FWC is satisfied that each employer covered by the agreement complied with subsection220(2) (which deals with giving employees a reasonable opportunity to decide etc.) in relation to the agreement; and If an application for the approval of a termination of an enterprise agreement is made under section222, the FWC must approve the termination if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223/b.content: the FWC is satisfied that the termination was agreed to in accordance with whichever of subsection221(1) or (2) applies (those subsections deal with agreement to the termination of different kinds of enterprise agreements by employee vote); and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223/c.content: the FWC is satisfied that there are no other reasonable grounds for believing that the employees have not agreed to the termination; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s223/d.content: the FWC considers that it is appropriate to approve the termination taking into account the views of the employee organisation or employee organisations (if any) covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s224.title: When termination comes into operation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s224.content:
If a termination of an enterprise agreement is approved under section223, the termination operates from the day specified in the decision to approve the termination.
Subdivision D—Termination of enterprise agreements after nominal expiry date

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s225.title: Application for termination of an enterprise agreement after its nominal expiry date

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s225/a.content: one or more of the employers covered by the agreement; If an enterprise agreement has passed its nominal expiry date, any of the following may apply to the FWC for the termination of the agreement:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s225/b.content: an employee covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s225/c.content: an employee organisation covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226.title: Terminating an enterprise agreement after its nominal expiry date
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226.content:
(1)If an application for the termination of an enterprise agreement is made under section225, the FWC must terminate the agreement if:
(a)the FWC is satisfied that the continued operation of the agreement would be unfair for the employees covered by the agreement; or
(b)the FWC is satisfied that the agreement does not, and is not likely to, cover any employees; or
(c)all of the following apply:
(i)the FWC is satisfied that the continued operation of the enterprise agreement would pose a significant threat to the viability of a business carried on by the employer, or employers, covered by the agreement;
(ii)the FWC is satisfied that the termination of the enterprise agreement would be likely to reduce the potential of terminations of employment covered by subsection(2) for the employees covered by the agreement;
(iii)if the agreement contains terms providing entitlements relating to the termination of employees’ employment—each employer covered by the agreement has given the FWC a guarantee of termination entitlements in relation to the termination of the agreement.
(1A)However, the FWC must terminate the enterprise agreement under subsection(1) only if the FWC is satisfied that it is appropriate in all the circumstances to do so.
(2)This subsection covers a termination of the employment of an employee:
(a)at the employer’s initiative because the employer no longer requires the job done by the employee to be done by anyone, except where this is due to the ordinary and customary turnover of labour; or
(b)because of the insolvency or bankruptcy of the employer.
(3)In deciding whether to terminate the agreement, the FWC must consider the views of the following covered by the agreement:
(a)the employees (unless there are no employees covered by the agreement);
(b)each employer;
(c)each employee organisation (if any).
(4)In deciding whether to terminate the agreement (theexisting agreement), the FWC must have regard to:
(a)whether the application was made at or after the notification time for a proposed enterprise agreement that will cover the same, or substantially the same, group of employees as the existing agreement; and
(b)whether bargaining for the proposed enterprise agreement is occurring; and
(c)whether the termination of the existing agreement would adversely affect the bargaining positionof the employees that will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement.
(5)In deciding whether to terminate the agreement, the FWC may also have regard to any other relevant matter.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/1/a.content: the FWC is satisfied that the continued operation of the agreement would be unfair for the employees covered by the agreement; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/1/b.content: the FWC is satisfied that the agreement does not, and is not likely to, cover any employees; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/1/i.content: the FWC is satisfied that the continued operation of the enterprise agreement would pose a significant threat to the viability of a business carried on by the employer, or employers, covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/1/ii.content: the FWC is satisfied that the termination of the enterprise agreement would be likely to reduce the potential of terminations of employment covered by subsection(2) for the employees covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/1/iii.content: if the agreement contains terms providing entitlements relating to the termination of employees’ employment—each employer covered by the agreement has given the FWC a guarantee of termination entitlements in relation to the termination of the agreement. /au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/4/b.content: whether bargaining for the proposed enterprise agreement is occurring; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/4/c.content: whether the termination of the existing agreement would adversely affect the bargaining positionof the employees that will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226/5.content: In deciding whether to terminate the agreement, the FWC may also have regard to any other relevant matter.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A.title: Guarantee of termination entitlements
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A.content:
Guarantee of termination entitlements
(1)Aguarantee of termination entitlementsis an undertaking given by an employer covered by an enterprise agreement that:
(a)is an undertaking that the employer will comply with subsection(3) if the agreement is terminated under section226 and the employer terminates the employment of a protected employee for the termination of the agreement:
(i)at the employer’s initiative because the employer no longer requires the job done by the employee to be done by anyone, except where this is due to the ordinary and customary turnover of labour; or
(ii)because of the insolvency or bankruptcy of the employer; and
(b)is in writing; and
(c)meets any requirements relating to the signing of undertakings that are prescribed by the regulations.
(2)Aprotected employeefor a termination of an enterprise agreement under section226 is an employee who would, but for the termination of the agreement, be covered by the agreement.
(3)For the purposes of paragraph(1)(a), the employer complies with this subsection, in relation to the termination of the protected employee’s employment, if the employer complies with the terms of the enterprise agreement that, if the agreement were still in operation, would have provided the employee with entitlements that:
(a)relate to a termination of the employee’s employment:
(i)at the employer’s initiative because the employer no longer requires the job done by the employee to be done by anyone, except where this is due to the ordinary and customary turnover of labour; or
(ii)because of the insolvency or bankruptcy of the employer; and
(b)except if the employee was an award/agreement free employee immediately before the termination of the employee’s employment—are more beneficial than the entitlements under a modern award that covered the employee in relation to the employment at that time.
When guarantee is in force
(4)A guarantee of termination entitlements given in relation to the termination of an enterprise agreement:
(a)comes into force on the day on which the termination of the agreement comes into operation under section227; and
(b)ceases to be in force at the earliest of the following times:
(i)if the guarantee specifies a period during which the guarantee is to remain in force and the FWC approves that period under subsection(5)—the end of that period;
(ii)immediately before another enterprise agreement that covers the same, or substantially the same, group of employees as the terminated agreement comes into force;
(iii)the end of the period of 4 years beginning on the day the guarantee is given to the FWC.
(5)The FWC may, in its decision terminating an enterprise agreement, approve a period for the purposes of subparagraph(4)(b)(i) if it considers the period to be appropriate.
Employer must comply with guarantee
(6)An employer must comply with a guarantee of termination entitlements given by the employer to the FWC in relation to the termination of an enterprise agreement if:
(a)the agreement is terminated under section226; and
(b)the employer terminates the employment of a protected employee for the termination of the agreement while the guarantee is in force:
(i)at the employer’s initiative because the employer no longer requires the job done by the employee to be done by anyone, except where this is due to the ordinary and customary turnover of labour; or
(ii)because of the insolvency or bankruptcy of the employer.
Guarantee is a governing instrument for employment
(7)To avoid doubt, a guarantee of termination entitlements is a governing instrument for employment for the purposes of theFair Entitlements Guarantee Act 2012.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/3/a.content: relate to a termination of the employee’s employment:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/3/i.content: at the employer’s initiative because the employer no longer requires the job done by the employee to be done by anyone, except where this is due to the ordinary and customary turnover of labour; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/3/b.content: except if the employee was an award/agreement free employee immediately before the termination of the employee’s employment—are more beneficial than the entitlements under a modern award that covered the employee in relation to the employment at that time. When guarantee is in force

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/4.content: A guarantee of termination entitlements given in relation to the termination of an enterprise agreement:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/4/a.content: comes into force on the day on which the termination of the agreement comes into operation under section227; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/4/b.content: ceases to be in force at the earliest of the following times:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/5.content: The FWC may, in its decision terminating an enterprise agreement, approve a period for the purposes of subparagraph(4)(b)(i) if it considers the period to be appropriate. Employer must comply with guarantee

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/6.content: An employer must comply with a guarantee of termination entitlements given by the employer to the FWC in relation to the termination of an enterprise agreement if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/6/a.content: the agreement is terminated under section226; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s226A/6/b.content: the employer terminates the employment of a protected employee for the termination of the agreement while the guarantee is in force:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227.title: When termination comes into operation
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227.content:
If an enterprise agreement is terminated under section226, the termination operates from the day specified in the decision to terminate the agreement.
CollapseDivision 7A—Reconsideration of whether an enterprise agreement passes the better off overall test

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A.title: Application for FWC to reconsider whether an enterprise agreement passes the better off overall test
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A.content:
(1)If the condition in subsection(2) is satisfied, any of the following may apply to the FWC for a reconsideration of whether an enterprise agreement passes the better off overall test:
(a)one or more of the employers covered by the agreement;
(b)an employee covered by the agreement;
(c)an employee organisation covered by the agreement.
(2)The condition in this subsection is satisfied if:
(a)before approving the agreement the FWC had regard, under subsection193A(6), to patterns or kinds of work, or types of employment engaged in, or to be engaged in, by:
(i)the award covered employees for the agreement; and
(ii)if the agreement is a single‑enterprise agreement that covers one or more employees to whom a supported bargaining agreement or a single interest employer agreement applies—those employees; and
(b)at the test time or a later time, one or more employees covered by subsection(4) or (5) engaged in other patterns or kinds of work, or other types of employment, to which the FWC did not have regard under subsection193A(6).
(4)An employee is covered by this subsection if, on the assumption that the test time mentioned in paragraph193(4)(b) were the time the application is made under subsection(1) of this section, the employee would be an award covered employee for the agreement.
(5)An employee is covered by this subsection if, on the assumption that the test time mentioned in section193 were the time the application is made under subsection(1) of this section, the employee would be an employee referred to in subparagraph(2)(a)(ii).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/1.content: If the condition in subsection(2) is satisfied, any of the following may apply to the FWC for a reconsideration of whether an enterprise agreement passes the better off overall test:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/1/a.content: one or more of the employers covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/1/b.content: an employee covered by the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/1/c.content: an employee organisation covered by the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/2.content: The condition in this subsection is satisfied if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/2/a.content: before approving the agreement the FWC had regard, under subsection193A(6), to patterns or kinds of work, or types of employment engaged in, or to be engaged in, by:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/2/i.content: the award covered employees for the agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/2/ii.content: if the agreement is a single‑enterprise agreement that covers one or more employees to whom a supported bargaining agreement or a single interest employer agreement applies—those employees; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/2/b.content: at the test time or a later time, one or more employees covered by subsection(4) or (5) engaged in other patterns or kinds of work, or other types of employment, to which the FWC did not have regard under subsection193A(6).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/4.content: An employee is covered by this subsection if, on the assumption that the test time mentioned in paragraph193(4)(b) were the time the application is made under subsection(1) of this section, the employee would be an award covered employee for the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227A/5.content: An employee is covered by this subsection if, on the assumption that the test time mentioned in section193 were the time the application is made under subsection(1) of this section, the employee would be an employee referred to in subparagraph(2)(a)(ii).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B.title: Reconsideration of whether an enterprise agreement passes the better off overall test
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B.content:
(1)If an application is made under subsection227A(1), the FWC must reconsider whether the agreement passes the better off overall test under section193.
(2)For the purposes of the reconsideration, sections193 and 193A have effect as if:
(a)the conditions in paragraphs193(4)(a) and (b) were satisfied in relation to an employee covered by subsection227A(4); and
(aa)in the case of an agreement of a kind covered by paragraph193(1)(b)—the condition that a supported bargaining agreement or a single interest employer agreement applies to the employees is satisfied in relation to an employee covered by subsection227A(5); and
(b)the words “the time the application for approval of the agreement by the FWC was made under subsection182(4) or section185” in subsection193(6) were omitted and the words “the time mentioned in subsection227B(2A)” were substituted; and
(c)the words “if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement—” in paragraph193A(3)(b) were omitted; and
(d)the words “in any case—a bargaining representative for the agreement” in paragraph193A(3)(c) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted; and
(e)the words “the bargaining representative or bargaining representatives of” in paragraph193A(4)(a) were omitted; and
(f)the words “the bargaining representative or bargaining representatives of award covered employees for the agreement (other than a bargaining representative that is not an employee organisation)” in paragraph193A(4)(b) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted; and
(fa)paragraph193A(4)(c) were omitted; and
(g)the words “if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement—” in paragraph193A(6A)(b) were omitted; and
(h)the words “in any case—a bargaining representative for the agreement” in paragraph193A(6A)(c) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted.
(2A)For the purposes of paragraph(2)(b), the time is:
(a)unless paragraph(b) applies—the time the application for approval of the agreement by the FWC was made under section185; or
(b)if the FWC has approved one or more variations of the agreement under section211—the time the application for approval of the most recent of those variations by the FWC was made under section210.
(3)If the FWC has a concern that the enterprise agreement does not pass the better off overall test, the FWC may:
(a)accept an undertaking from one or more employers covered by the agreement if the FWC is satisfied the undertaking addresses the concern; or
(b)amend the agreement if the FWC is satisfied the amendment is necessary to address the concern.
(4)An amendment under paragraph(3)(b) operates from:
(a)7 days after the FWC makes the amendment; or
(b)if another day is specified in the amendment (which may be a day before the amendment is made)—that other day.
(5)The FWC must specify a day before the amendment is made for the purposes of paragraph(4)(b) if the FWC considers that it is necessary for the amendment to operate from the earlier day to address the concern to which the amendment relates.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/1.content: If an application is made under subsection227A(1), the FWC must reconsider whether the agreement passes the better off overall test under section193.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2.content: For the purposes of the reconsideration, sections193 and 193A have effect as if:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/a.content: unless paragraph(b) applies—the time the application for approval of the agreement by the FWC was made under section185; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/aa.content: in the case of an agreement of a kind covered by paragraph193(1)(b)—the condition that a supported bargaining agreement or a single interest employer agreement applies to the employees is satisfied in relation to an employee covered by subsection227A(5); and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/b.content: if the FWC has approved one or more variations of the agreement under section211—the time the application for approval of the most recent of those variations by the FWC was made under section210.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/c.content: the words “if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement—” in paragraph193A(3)(b) were omitted; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/d.content: the words “in any case—a bargaining representative for the agreement” in paragraph193A(3)(c) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/e.content: the words “the bargaining representative or bargaining representatives of” in paragraph193A(4)(a) were omitted; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/f.content: the words “the bargaining representative or bargaining representatives of award covered employees for the agreement (other than a bargaining representative that is not an employee organisation)” in paragraph193A(4)(b) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/g.content: the words “if the agreement is not a greenfields agreement—” in paragraph193A(6A)(b) were omitted; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/2/h.content: the words “in any case—a bargaining representative for the agreement” in paragraph193A(6A)(c) were omitted and the words “the employee organisation or employee organisations that are covered by the agreement” were substituted. (2A)For the purposes of paragraph(2)(b), the time is:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/3.content: If the FWC has a concern that the enterprise agreement does not pass the better off overall test, the FWC may:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/3/a.content: accept an undertaking from one or more employers covered by the agreement if the FWC is satisfied the undertaking addresses the concern; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/3/b.content: amend the agreement if the FWC is satisfied the amendment is necessary to address the concern.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/4.content: An amendment under paragraph(3)(b) operates from:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/4/a.content: 7 days after the FWC makes the amendment; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/4/b.content: if another day is specified in the amendment (which may be a day before the amendment is made)—that other day.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227B/5.content: The FWC must specify a day before the amendment is made for the purposes of paragraph(4)(b) if the FWC considers that it is necessary for the amendment to operate from the earlier day to address the concern to which the amendment relates.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C.title: Effect of undertakings
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C.content:
(1)If:
(a)the FWC accepts an undertaking under paragraph227B(3)(a) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and
(b)the agreement covers a single employer;
the undertaking is taken to be a term of the agreement, as the agreement applies to the employer.
(2)If:
(a)the FWC accepts an undertaking under paragraph227B(3)(a) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and
(b)the agreement covers 2 or more employers;
the undertaking is taken to be a term of the agreement, as the agreement applies to each employer that gave the undertaking.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C/1/a.content: the FWC accepts an undertaking under paragraph227B(3)(a) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C/1/b.content: the agreement covers a single employer; the undertaking is taken to be a term of the agreement, as the agreement applies to the employer.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C/2/a.content: the FWC accepts an undertaking under paragraph227B(3)(a) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227C/2/b.content: the agreement covers 2 or more employers; the undertaking is taken to be a term of the agreement, as the agreement applies to each employer that gave the undertaking.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D.title: Effect of amendment
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D.content:
(1)If:
(a)the FWC makes an amendment under paragraph227B(3)(b) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and
(b)the agreement covers a single employer;
the agreement is taken to be amended by the amendment, as the agreement applies to the employer.
(2)If:
(a)the FWC makes an amendment under paragraph227B(3)(b) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and
(b)the agreement covers 2 or more employers;
the agreement is taken to be amended by the amendment, as the agreement applies to each employer.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D/1/a.content: the FWC makes an amendment under paragraph227B(3)(b) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D/1/b.content: the agreement covers a single employer; the agreement is taken to be amended by the amendment, as the agreement applies to the employer.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D/2/a.content: the FWC makes an amendment under paragraph227B(3)(b) in relation to an enterprise agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227D/2/b.content: the agreement covers 2 or more employers; the agreement is taken to be amended by the amendment, as the agreement applies to each employer.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227E.title: No creation of liability to pay pecuniary penalty for past conduct

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227E/1.content: This section applies if an amendment of an enterprise agreement made under paragraph227B(3)(b) has a retrospective effect because it comes into operation on a day before the day on which the amendment is made. Application of this section No creation of liability to pay pecuniary penalty for past conduct

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227E/2/a.content: a person engaged in conduct before the amendment was made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s227E/2/b.content: but for the retrospective effect of the amendment, the conduct would not have contravened a term of the enterprise agreement; a court must not order a person to pay a pecuniary penalty under Division2 of Part4‑1 in relation to the conduct, on the grounds that the conduct contravened a term of an enterprise agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/part-2\u20114/div-8.title: Division 8—FWC’s general role in facilitating bargaining

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228.title: Bargaining representatives must meet the good faith bargaining requirements

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1.content: The following are thegood faith bargaining requirementsthat a bargaining representative for a proposed enterprise agreement must meet:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/a.content: attending, and participating in, meetings at reasonable times;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/b.content: disclosing relevant information (other than confidential or commercially sensitive information) in a timely manner;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/c.content: responding to proposals made by other bargaining representatives for the agreement in a timely manner;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/d.content: giving genuine consideration to the proposals of other bargaining representatives for the agreement, and giving reasons for the bargaining representative’s responses to those proposals;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/e.content: refraining from capricious or unfair conduct that undermines freedom of association or collective bargaining;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/1/f.content: recognising and bargaining with the other bargaining representatives for the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/2.content: The good faith bargaining requirements do not require:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/2/a.content: a bargaining representative to make concessions during bargaining for the agreement; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s228/2/b.content: a bargaining representative to reach agreement on the terms that are to be included in the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229.title: Applications for bargaining orders
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229.content:
Persons who may apply for a bargaining order
(1)A bargaining representative for a proposed enterprise agreement may apply to the FWC for an order (abargaining order) under section230 in relation to the agreement.
Multi‑enterprise agreements
(2)An application for a bargaining order must not be made in relation to a proposed multi‑enterprise agreement unless a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the agreement.
Timing of applications
(3)The application may only be made at whichever of the following times applies:
(a)if one or more enterprise agreements apply to an employee, or employees, who will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement:
(i)not more than 90 days before the nominal expiry date of the enterprise agreement, or the latest nominal expiry date of those enterprise agreements (as the case may be); or
(ii)after an employer that will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement has requested under subsection181(1) that employees approve the agreement, but before the agreement is so approved;
(b)otherwise—at any time.
Prerequisites for making an application
(4)The bargaining representative may only apply for the bargaining order if the bargaining representative:
(a)has concerns that:
(i)one or more of the bargaining representatives for the agreement have not met, or are not meeting, the good faith bargaining requirements; or
(ii)the bargaining process is not proceeding efficiently or fairly because there are multiple bargaining representatives for the agreement; and
(b)has given a written notice setting out those concerns to the relevant bargaining representatives; and
(c)has given the relevant bargaining representatives a reasonable time within which to respond to those concerns; and
(d)considers that the relevant bargaining representatives have not responded appropriately to those concerns.
Non‑compliance with notice requirements may be permitted
(5)The FWC may consider the application even if it does not comply with paragraph(4)(b) or (c) if the FWC is satisfied that it is appropriate in all the circumstances to do so.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/1.content: A bargaining representative for a proposed enterprise agreement may apply to the FWC for an order (abargaining order) under section230 in relation to the agreement. Persons who may apply for a bargaining order Multi‑enterprise agreements

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/2.content: An application for a bargaining order must not be made in relation to a proposed multi‑enterprise agreement unless a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the agreement. Timing of applications

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/3.content: The application may only be made at whichever of the following times applies:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/3/a.content: if one or more enterprise agreements apply to an employee, or employees, who will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/3/i.content: not more than 90 days before the nominal expiry date of the enterprise agreement, or the latest nominal expiry date of those enterprise agreements (as the case may be); or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/3/ii.content: after an employer that will be covered by the proposed enterprise agreement has requested under subsection181(1) that employees approve the agreement, but before the agreement is so approved;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/3/b.content: otherwise—at any time. Prerequisites for making an application

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4.content: The bargaining representative may only apply for the bargaining order if the bargaining representative:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4/i.content: one or more of the bargaining representatives for the agreement have not met, or are not meeting, the good faith bargaining requirements; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4/ii.content: the bargaining process is not proceeding efficiently or fairly because there are multiple bargaining representatives for the agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4/b.content: has given a written notice setting out those concerns to the relevant bargaining representatives; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4/c.content: has given the relevant bargaining representatives a reasonable time within which to respond to those concerns; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/4/d.content: considers that the relevant bargaining representatives have not responded appropriately to those concerns. Non‑compliance with notice requirements may be permitted

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s229/5.content: The FWC may consider the application even if it does not comply with paragraph(4)(b) or (c) if the FWC is satisfied that it is appropriate in all the circumstances to do so.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230.title: When the FWC may make a bargaining order
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230.content:
Bargaining orders
(1)The FWC may make a bargaining order under this section in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement if:
(a)an application for the order has been made; and
(b)the requirements of this section are met in relation to the agreement; and
(c)the FWC is satisfied that it is reasonable in all the circumstances to make the order.
Agreement to bargain or certain instruments in operation
(2)The FWC must be satisfied in all cases that one of the following applies:
(a)the employer or employers have agreed to bargain, or have initiated bargaining, for the agreement;
(aa)the employer or employers have received a request to bargain under subsection173(2A) in relation to the agreement;
(b)a majority support determination in relation to the agreement is in operation;
(c)a scope order in relation to the agreement is in operation;
(d)all of the employers are specified in a supported bargaining authorisation that is in operation in relation to the agreement;
(e)all of the employers are specified in a single interest employer authorisation that is in operation in relation to the agreement.
Good faith bargaining requirements not met
(3)The FWC must in all cases be satisfied:
(a)that:
(i)one or more of the relevant bargaining representatives for the agreement have not met, or are not meeting, the good faith bargaining requirements; or
(ii)the bargaining process is not proceeding efficiently or fairly because there are multiple bargaining representatives for the agreement; and
(b)that the applicant has complied with the requirements of subsection229(4) (which deals with notifying relevant bargaining representatives of concerns), unless subsection229(5) permitted the applicant to make the application without complying with those requirements.
Bargaining order must be in accordance with section231
(4)The bargaining order must be in accordance with section231 (which deals with what a bargaining order must specify).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/1.content: The FWC may make a bargaining order under this section in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement if: Bargaining orders

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/1/a.content: an application for the order has been made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/1/b.content: the requirements of this section are met in relation to the agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/1/c.content: the FWC is satisfied that it is reasonable in all the circumstances to make the order. Agreement to bargain or certain instruments in operation

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2.content: The FWC must be satisfied in all cases that one of the following applies:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/a.content: the employer or employers have agreed to bargain, or have initiated bargaining, for the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/aa.content: the employer or employers have received a request to bargain under subsection173(2A) in relation to the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/b.content: a majority support determination in relation to the agreement is in operation;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/c.content: a scope order in relation to the agreement is in operation;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/d.content: all of the employers are specified in a supported bargaining authorisation that is in operation in relation to the agreement;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/2/e.content: all of the employers are specified in a single interest employer authorisation that is in operation in relation to the agreement. Good faith bargaining requirements not met

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/3.content: The FWC must in all cases be satisfied:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/3/i.content: one or more of the relevant bargaining representatives for the agreement have not met, or are not meeting, the good faith bargaining requirements; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/3/ii.content: the bargaining process is not proceeding efficiently or fairly because there are multiple bargaining representatives for the agreement; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/3/b.content: that the applicant has complied with the requirements of subsection229(4) (which deals with notifying relevant bargaining representatives of concerns), unless subsection229(5) permitted the applicant to make the application without complying with those requirements. Bargaining order must be in accordance with section231

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s230/4.content: The bargaining order must be in accordance with section231 (which deals with what a bargaining order must specify).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231.title: What a bargaining order must specify

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/1.content: A bargaining order in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement must specify all or any of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/1/a.content: the actions to be taken by, and requirements imposed upon, the bargaining representatives for the agreement, for the purpose of ensuring that they meet the good faith bargaining requirements;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/1/b.content: requirements imposed upon those bargaining representatives not to take action that would constitute capricious or unfair conduct that undermines freedom of association or collective bargaining;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/1/c.content: the actions to be taken by those bargaining representatives to deal with the effects of such capricious or unfair conduct;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/1/d.content: such matters, actions or requirements as the FWC considers appropriate, taking into account subparagraph230(3)(a)(ii) (which deals with multiple bargaining representatives), for the purpose of promoting the efficient or fair conduct of bargaining for the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/2.content: The kinds of bargaining orders that the FWC may make in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement include the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/2/a.content: an order excluding a bargaining representative for the agreement from bargaining;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/2/b.content: an order requiring some or all of the bargaining representatives of the employees who will be covered by the agreement to meet and appoint one of the bargaining representatives to represent the bargaining representatives in bargaining;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/2/c.content: an order that an employer not terminate the employment of an employee, if the termination would constitute, or relate to, a failure by a bargaining representative to meet the good faith bargaining requirement referred to in paragraph228(1)(e) (which deals with capricious or unfair conduct that undermines freedom of association or collective bargaining);

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/2/d.content: an order to reinstate an employee whose employment has been terminated if the termination constitutes, or relates to, a failure by a bargaining representative to meet the good faith bargaining requirement referred to in paragraph228(1)(e) (which deals with capricious or unfair conduct that undermines freedom of association or collective bargaining).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/3/a.content: specify the factors the FWC may or must take into account in deciding whether or not to make a bargaining order for reinstatement of an employee; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s231/3/b.content: provide for the FWC to take action and make orders in connection with, and to deal with matters relating to, a bargaining order of that kind.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232.title: Operation of a bargaining order

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/a.content: comes into operation on the day on which it is made; and A bargaining order in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/b.content: ceases to be in operation at the earliest of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/i.content: if the order is revoked—the time specified in the instrument of revocation;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/ii.content: when the agreement is approved by the FWC;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/iii.content: when a workplace determination that covers the employees that would have been covered by the agreement comes into operation;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s232/iv.content: when the bargaining representatives for the agreement agree that bargaining has ceased.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s233.title: Contravening a bargaining order
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s233.content:
A person to whom a bargaining order applies must not contravene a term of the order.
Subdivision B—Intractable bargaining declarations

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s234.title: Applications for intractable bargaining declarations
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s234.content:
(1)A bargaining representative for a proposed enterprise agreement, other than a greenfields agreement, may apply to the FWC for a declaration (anintractable bargaining declaration) under section235 in relation to the agreement.
(2)An application for an intractable bargaining declaration must not be made in relation to a proposed multi‑enterprise agreement unless a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s234/1.content: A bargaining representative for a proposed enterprise agreement, other than a greenfields agreement, may apply to the FWC for a declaration (anintractable bargaining declaration) under section235 in relation to the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s234/2.content: An application for an intractable bargaining declaration must not be made in relation to a proposed multi‑enterprise agreement unless a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235.title: When the FWC may make an intractable bargaining declaration
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235.content:
Intractable bargaining declaration
(1)The FWC may make an intractable bargaining declaration in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement if:
(a)an application for the declaration has been made; and
(b)the FWC is satisfied of the matters set out in subsection(2); and
(c)it is after the end of the minimum bargaining period (see subsection(5)).
Matters of which the FWC must be satisfied before making an intractable bargaining declaration
(2)The FWC must be satisfied that:
(a)the FWC has dealt with the dispute about the agreement under section240 and the applicant participated in the FWC’s processes to deal with the dispute; and
(b)there is no reasonable prospect of agreement being reached if the FWC does not make the declaration; and
(c)it is reasonable in all the circumstances to make the declaration, taking into account the views of all the bargaining representatives for the agreement.
What declaration must specify
(3)The declaration must specify:
(a)the date it is made; and
(b)the proposed enterprise agreement to which it relates; and
(c)any other matter prescribed by the procedural rules.
Operation of declaration
(4)The declaration:
(a)comes into operation on the day it is made; and
(b)ceases to be in operation when each employer specified in the declaration is covered by an enterprise agreement or a workplace determination.
End of the minimum bargaining period
(5)Theend of the minimum bargaining periodin relation to a proposed enterprise agreement is:
(a)if one or more enterprise agreements (theexisting agreements) apply to any of the employees that will be covered by the proposed agreement—the later of the following:
(i)the day that is 9 months after the nominal expiry date for that existing agreement, or the latest nominal expiry date for those existing agreements;
(ii)the day that is 9 months after the day bargaining starts, as worked out under subsection(6); or
(b)the day that is 9 months after the day bargaining starts, as worked out under subsection(6).
(6)For the purposes of subparagraph(5)(a)(ii) and paragraph(5)(b), the day bargaining starts for a proposed agreement is:
(a)if a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the proposed agreement—the day that the authorisation first comes into operation; or
(b)otherwise—the notification time for the proposed agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/1.content: The FWC may make an intractable bargaining declaration in relation to a proposed enterprise agreement if: Intractable bargaining declaration

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/1/a.content: an application for the declaration has been made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/1/b.content: the FWC is satisfied of the matters set out in subsection(2); and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/1/c.content: it is after the end of the minimum bargaining period (see subsection(5)). Matters of which the FWC must be satisfied before making an intractable bargaining declaration

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/2.content: The FWC must be satisfied that:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/2/a.content: the FWC has dealt with the dispute about the agreement under section240 and the applicant participated in the FWC’s processes to deal with the dispute; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/2/b.content: there is no reasonable prospect of agreement being reached if the FWC does not make the declaration; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/2/c.content: it is reasonable in all the circumstances to make the declaration, taking into account the views of all the bargaining representatives for the agreement. What declaration must specify

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/3/a.content: the date it is made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/3/b.content: the proposed enterprise agreement to which it relates; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/3/c.content: any other matter prescribed by the procedural rules. Operation of declaration

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/4/a.content: comes into operation on the day it is made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/4/b.content: ceases to be in operation when each employer specified in the declaration is covered by an enterprise agreement or a workplace determination. End of the minimum bargaining period

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/5.content: Theend of the minimum bargaining periodin relation to a proposed enterprise agreement is:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/5/a.content: if one or more enterprise agreements (theexisting agreements) apply to any of the employees that will be covered by the proposed agreement—the later of the following:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/5/i.content: the day that is 9 months after the nominal expiry date for that existing agreement, or the latest nominal expiry date for those existing agreements;

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/5/ii.content: the day that is 9 months after the day bargaining starts, as worked out under subsection(6); or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/5/b.content: the day that is 9 months after the day bargaining starts, as worked out under subsection(6).

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/6.content: For the purposes of subparagraph(5)(a)(ii) and paragraph(5)(b), the day bargaining starts for a proposed agreement is:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/6/a.content: if a supported bargaining authorisation or single interest employer authorisation is in operation in relation to the proposed agreement—the day that the authorisation first comes into operation; or

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235/6/b.content: otherwise—the notification time for the proposed agreement.

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235A.title: Post‑declaration negotiating period
/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235A.content:
(1)The FWC may, if it considers it appropriate to do so, specify in the declaration a period (thepost‑declaration negotiating period) that:
(a)starts on the day the declaration is made; and
(b)ends on:
(i)the day specified by the FWC in the declaration; or
(ii)any later day determined under subsection(2).
(2)The FWC may, if it considers it appropriate to do so and taking into account any views of the bargaining representatives, extend the period referred to in subsection(1) by determining a later day for the purposes of subparagraph(1)(b)(ii).
Subdivision C—Majority support determinations and scope orders

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235A/1.content: The FWC may, if it considers it appropriate to do so, specify in the declaration a period (thepost‑declaration negotiating period) that:

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235A/1/a.content: starts on the day the declaration is made; and

/au-federal/fwa/2009/s235A/1/i.content: the day specified by the FWC in the declaration; or
